description:
Non-Material Amendment to planning permission P2018/0523/FUL, Dated: 22/02/2019 for Demolition of the existing building (in Use Classes B1(a) offices, and B8 storage and distribution). Erection of a new building of 6 storeys, including retention of existing basement, plus rooftop plant and enclosure; and associated works, to provide 9,221 square metres (GIA) for use as B1(a) offices. 
The proposed amendments are:  1) Fifth floor access door to Bonhill Street terrace revised to suit tenant detailed space planning. 2) Ground floor access door to Bonhill Street omitted as it is not required by tenant. 3) Ground floor escape doors revised following detailed design relating to adjacent No 30 Tabernacle Street building. 4) Introduction of smoke vents required for emergency ventilation and life safety in the event of a fire. 5) Introduction of new main entrance revolving door and associated pass doors to serve the new Lower Ground & Ground Floor separate office demise. 6) Canopy introduced to give shelter for cyclists storing their cycles/showering in the tenant cycle store on the route to entering their demise. 7) Louvres introduced to facilitate the tenants fit-out requirements. 8) Section of vertical plant screen introduced to facilitate the tenant's mechanical fit-out requirements. 9) Revisions to cycle parking and associated facilities at ground and lower ground floor level.
decision_conditions: REASON: The proposed revolving door would fail to ensure the entrance remains inclusive and accessible to all users. Therefore, the proposed amendments are unacceptable, contrary to policies DM2.1 and DM2.2 of the Development Management Policies (2013) and the Inclusive Design in Islington Supplementary Planning Document (February 2014).  As such, the proposed amendments would not constitute a non-material amendment and are unacceptable in planning terms.
